GeneticAlgorithm

Class Population

  • java.lang.Object
    • GeneticAlgorithm.Population

  • abstract class Population
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that implements static methods to manage populations, i.e., collections of Individuals

    • Method Detail

      • getFittest

        static Individual getFittest(Individual[] participants)
        Returns, if any, the Individual with the highest fitness value
        Parameters:
        participants - a collection of Individuals
        Returns:
        an Individual with the highest fitness value or the first one if they all have the same

      • initialize

        static Individual[] initialize(int populationSize)
        Creates a collection of randomly generated Individuals
        Parameters:
        populationSize - the amount of Individuals to generate
        Returns:
        the collection of individuals

      • evolve

        static Individual[] evolve(Individual[] population,
                           int populationSize,
                           int tournamentSize,
                           boolean elitism,
                           double mutationRate)
        * Evolve a given population, i.e., generate a new one from it by: * 1. If elitism is true, the fittest Individual is gotten from the given generation and cloned into the new one * To generate each of the new Individuals: * 2. Get a father and a mother winners of a tournament * 3, Generate a new individual as the result of a crossover among the progenitors * 4. With a given likelihood, mutate this new individual
        Parameters:
        population - the collection of not null individuals from which the new population will be generated
        populationSize - the amount of individuals the populations must have
        tournamentSize - the amount of individuals that can participate in a tournament
        elitism - a flag indicating if the fittest individual of the population must be conserved
        mutationRate - the probability [0, 1] the new individuals have to mutate when born
        Returns:
        a new population evolved from the given one

      • tournamentSelection

        private static Individual tournamentSelection(Individual[] population,
                                              int tournamentSize)
        A tournament is defined as follows: 1. Given a population, a fixed amount of participants are chosen randomly 2. The winner is the one with the highest fitness value
        Parameters:
        population - the set of participants that may participate in the tournament
        tournamentSize - the amount of participants that can be chosen to compete
        Returns:
        the fittest individual among the chosen ones

      • crossover

        private static Individual crossover(Individual father,
                                    Individual mother)
        The crossover is the operation by which a new individual can be generated based on the genes of two different individuals by choosing randomly among them
        Parameters:
        father - an individual winner of a tournament
        mother - another individual winner of a tournament
        Returns:
        a "child" with the genes of the two given objects
